Baahubali: The Eternal War – Part 1 is an upcoming Indian Telugu-language 3D animated epic mythological film produced by Shobu Yarlagadda and Prasad Devineni under Arka Media Works and directed by Ishan Shukla from a screenplay by Scott Mosier. The music is composed by M. M. Keeravani. The film expands the universe of the Baahubali saga and is presented by its creator S. S. Rajamouli.
Premise
Set in the wake of the cliffhanger that ended Baahubali: The Beginning, the story follows the betrayed and slain prince Amarendra Baahubali as he journeys into the afterlife. There, he traverses the fourteen realms of existence, forming unlikely alliances and confronting divine forces beyond mortal comprehension, in a struggle to restore balance to the cosmos.
The teaser shows a confrontation between Vishasura and Indra, amidst the ruins of Tripura in Paataala Lokam, the celestial cities destroyed by Lord Shiva, before Baahubali makes a swashbuckling entry on a chariot to take on Indra.
Voice cast
* Prabhas as Amarendra Baahubali
* Ramya Krishna as Sivagami
Production
Development
Ahead of the re-release of Baahubali: The Epic on 31 October 2025, S. S. Rajamouli announced a new 3D animated feature titled Baahubali – The Eternal War, with an estimated budget of ₹120 crore.  In November 2025, global production companies Aniventure, Zaratan, and Alcyde announced a partnership with Arka Media Works to produce the film.  The film is directed by Ishan Shukla (Star Wars: Visions) from a screenplay by Scott Mosier (Clerks, Dogma, The Grinch), with Rajamouli serving as producer.
Rajamouli described the film as a “seamless, organic extension” of the world of Baahubali, saying it will “thrill long-time fans and invite new audiences in.”
Animation
The film's animation is a joint international effort between Mihira Visual Labs (India), Aniventure (United Kingdom), Zaratan (Scotland), Alcyde (France), and Les Androids Associes (France).
Aniventure’s Adam Nagle spearheaded the production deal, partnering with Zaratan’s Andrew Pearce and Paula Bird to deliver pre-production. Alcyde Studio was brought on to develop the film’s visual look and guide storyboards, 3D previsualization, and key character designs to ensure visual coherence.
Antoine Charreyron serves as animation director for Alcyde Studio, with Production Designer Florent Auguy and CG Supervisor Dorian Marchesin leading the creative vision. The film’s art style has been compared to Arcane by Fortiche, and GameVicio described it as “India’s answer to the Spider-Verse.”
Teaser and marketing
The first teaser premiered theatrically alongside Baahubali: The Epic and was released digitally on 4 November 2025. It received widespread attention for its mythological scale, visual fidelity, and cosmic tone.
Release
Baahubali – The Eternal War Part 1 is scheduled for release in 2027, with exact dates and distribution details yet to be announced.
Sequel
The film is conceived as a two-part animated feature, with Part 1 being the first installment and a second part planned for future release.
